notes: Charles, Hurst, & Notowidigdo (2018), 'Housing Booms and Busts, Labor Market Outcomes, and College Attendance'. Cross-sectional IV at MSA level. Housing demand shock (hp_growth_real_00_06 = deltaP + units_growth, 2000-2006 housing boom) instrumented by housing supply elasticity (Saiz instrument, variable 'iv'). Multiple outcome categories: employment (Table 1), wages (Table 2), college enrollment (Table 3). Controls: college_share_2000, female_employed_share_2000, pop_prev, share_foreign_18_55_2000. Weighted by MSA population. Clustered at state level.

design_audit.notes: ivreg2 depvar (hp_growth_real_00_06 = iv) controls [aw=weight], cluster(statefip). Cross-sectional (not panel). MSA-level long differences 2000-2006. First-stage F-stat (Kleibergen-Paap) reported.

claim_object.outcome_concept: Change in employment-to-population ratio for young men (18-25) during the housing boom (2000-2006)
claim_object.treatment_concept: Housing demand shock (combined house price growth + housing units growth, 2000-2006), instrumented by housing supply elasticity
claim_object.estimand_concept: LATE of housing boom on employment, identified via variation in housing supply elasticity across MSAs

baseline_specs.label: Table1-IV-Employment
baseline_specs.notes: Table 1, IV column. Change in employment-pop ratio for 18-25 year-olds, both sexes. Weighted by MSA employment, clustered by state.

constraints.notes: Controls are used in both first and second stage (linked). Baseline controls: college_share_2000, female_employed_share_2000, pop_prev, share_foreign_18_55_2000. Robustness table adds region FE, manuf_18_55_2000, routine_share_2000, unemp_18_55_2000.

canonical.notes: Cluster-robust SE at state level, matching the paper.

sampling.notes: 4 baseline controls + 4 additional (manuf, routine, unemp, region FE). Full build-up matching the paper's robustness table, plus random subsets.

diagnostics_plan.linkage: Computed for each IV spec via Kleibergen-Paap F-stat from ivreg2

design_audit.notes: Same IV setup as G1 but for college enrollment outcomes. Weighted by population (not employment).

claim_object.outcome_concept: Change in college enrollment rate for young people (18-25) during the housing boom (2000-2007)
claim_object.treatment_concept: Housing demand shock (2000-2006), instrumented by housing supply elasticity
claim_object.estimand_concept: LATE of housing boom on college enrollment, identified via variation in housing supply elasticity
claim_object.target_population: US MSAs, 2000-2007 changes in education attainment

baseline_specs.label: Table3-IV-AnyCollege-18-25
baseline_specs.notes: Table 3, IV column. Change in any-college rate for 18-25 year-olds. Weighted by population.

baseline_specs.label: Table3-IV-Bachelor-18-25
baseline_specs.notes: Table 3, IV column. Change in bachelor's rate for 18-25 year-olds.
